Nashua.Litchfield, New Hampshire:
Litchfield is a town in Hillsborough County, New Hampshire, United States. The population was 8,271 at the 2010 census.


== History ==
Most of Litchfield was part of the large town known as Dunstable, which was organized in the 1600s and included land along both sides of the disputed New Hampshire-Massachusetts boundary, and out of which were carved several towns and cities in both states.
